Choose an archetype or mix and match cards to create your own super. You will choose Attack and Defense Powers for your super as well as Enhancements to make those Powers more intense. There are also NOW! cards which allow you to break in and cause an immediate game effect. When you want to slow your opponents down, you can play Limitation cards on their Powers to hinder them or remove them completely!

Once you have dominated the competition and you're the only super left standing, you win! Knock them out or kill them, its up to you. Either way, the last one standing wins!

There are currently 4 decks built around classic comic book archetypes; Blaster, Gadget, Powerhouse, & Psionic.
The starter comes with two pre-constructed archetype decks; the heavy hitting Powerhouse and the all-around Blaster. More archetypes are in development all the time, this allows the Infinite Power world to keep growing and new combinations of cards to be combined to create new play experiences!
These decks can also be mixed and matched to make a unique deck as well.

Card Types
Attack cards combine damage and conditions to break down your opponent(s).
Defense cards protect you from damage and effects as well as putting you into various states, such as Intangible and Invisible.
Enhancement cards are attached to your Attacks & Defenses to enhance them.
NOW! cards are instant effects that free you from conditions or change the flow of the game.
Limitation cards are attached to Opponents' Attacks & Defenses to slow them down or give them difficult choices to make.

Custom decks are made of 60 cards, with no more than 3 copies of any one card and no more than 15 cards of any of the above types.

When you buy a deck, you get a full 60 cards (3 copies of 20 unique cards).
We plan to release new decks regularly and we have some other card types we will add to the game as well as we continue to grow.

Additional Components:
1 eight-sided die
16 Power Counters
22 double sided Condition Cards
2 Turn Cards
106315.name: Infinite Power Expandable Card Game Starter

106316.name: Armaëth: The Lost Kingdom
106316.description:
User Summary

Armaëth is a typical fantasy adventure similar to the King's Quest series.

The country was once ruled by the wise dwarf king Armaëth whose people lived in harmony with the elves. But Menankar hated all of them and the master of dark forces raised his evil creatures and used his minions to conquer the kingdom.

After long years of war the evil forces were defeated by the combined arms of the dwarves and elves. Since their kingdom has been ruined they left it and retreated into a secred kingdom called Dol Armaeth.

The old lands have long been claimed by the humans. Once of them, Killian, now starts his adventure in search for the legendary Dol Armaeth.

106317.name: The Sims 3: Generations
106317.description:
Enjoy a whole spectrum of rich life experiences with your Sims! Start off in the imagination-fuelled world of childhood and embrace the drama of the teen years. Experience the complicated realities of adult life, then reap the benefits of growing up in each life stage. A wealth of new options and activities makes your Sims’ lives more meaningful than ever before, whatever their ages. With new celebrations, dramatic life events, and all-new ways for your Sims to express their creativity, The Sims 3 Generations lets your Sims live life to the fullest!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgamehonor.12911: 2009 Vuoden Peli Children's Game of the Year Nominee

106318.name: Autot: Rallipeli
106318.description: Children's racing game themed in Disney Pixar movie Cars. Race around the oval shaped track based on die rolls. If you cross the finish line without having two pit stops, you need to race for another lap.

106319.name: The Sims 3 Deluxe
106319.description:
User Summary

This compilation contains both The Sims 3 and its expansion The Sims 3: Ambitions.

106320.name: Race Pro
106320.description:
From the developer's website:

RACE Pro recreates a breathtaking reality giving gamers the ultimate racing simulation experience, all powered by Lizard, SimBin’s own physics engine. With precision physics and handling, racers will feel every bend and burst of acceleration along with every emotion from pre-race tension in the pit lanes to the exhilaration of capturing the chequered flag.

RACE Pro provides unrivalled realism and deep immersion into the racing world through ultra realistic car models and official FIA championships and tracks. Putting players in the driving seats of their simulated racing careers, racers will have the opportunity to work their way up the leader boards through intense training and winning key races. RACE Pro has something for everyone, allowing players of all levels to pick up and play, while offering challenging tracks and advanced modes for the more experienced players.

RACE Pro offers a wealth of cars ranging from 200 to over 1000 horse power, as well as a host of championships including WTCC (World Touring Car Championship), Formula 3000 and Formula BMW. GT cars from manufacturers including Aston Martin and Saleen take their place on the grid as well as production cars such as the Audi R8 and Dodge Viper SRT10.

In addition, RACE Pro is exclusively bringing all the WTCC cars from manufacturers Alfa Romeo, BMW, Chevrolet and Seat to Xbox 360 for the very first time. For a blast of accessible fun, the Mini Cooper Challenge invites players of all abilities to take the wheel.

106321.name: And Thence To Almery
106321.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This publication follows on from Beyond the Mountains of Magnatz and is the final in the epic Footsteps of Fools series.

Stranded in the desolate barren reaches of the upper Scamander, all seems lost until a peculiar band of pilgrims and their raft are discovered. After the perils of the mighty river, and colorful escapades at diverse unique small settlements, the PCs may with luck & skill arrive alive at decaying & decadent Erze Damath: the mysterious city of the Black Obelisk. Numerous hazardous adventures fill the weeks, whilst PCs determinedly seek the means to safely cross the vast & desolate barrens that now are all that remains between them and ‘home’.

Eventually reaching squalid & pompous Old Romarth, they seek out a set of legendary allies, with whose aid they hopefully arrive at Azenomei. If so they can confront their arch-nemesis – Iucounu the Laughing Magician – in a twisted & desperate battle of wits & magic around the echoing corridors of Pergolo.

106322.name: Inspector Gadget
106322.description:
User Summary

Dr Claw has kidnapped Penny and it is your job as Inspector Gadget to get her back. With the help of Brain the dog and his gadget powers the inspector must battle through various stages and an army of M.A.D. agents to save the day

106323.name: Sleepwalker
106323.description:
User Summary:

Sleepwalker is a game by Zeppelin Games from 1991. The game take place in a large house. In the game you, as nephew Rory, must guide uncle Silas back to his bed.

106324.name: Arm of Revenge
106324.description:
User Summary

A beat em up game with role playing elements (gain experience), and fighting elements such as combos. You are taking revenge on a crime syndicate for the murder of your father.

106325.name: Armor Heroes 2
106325.description:
User Summary

A basic flash beat em up game. One twist is that you can swap your characters, each character is better or worse in different situations. You can also take various animals as mounts for a little more variety.

106326.name: Jumpgate: The Reconstruction Initiative
106326.description:
In the game, jumpgates are used to travel from sector to sector. All sectors, without a station, consist of asteroids and a beacon. Many have Player Owned Stations and may have items related to events run by GMs. Station sectors all have a planet within the sector. The player is the pilot of a spacecraft, acquiring wealth and status by engaging in trade, mining, and/or combat. Players may work on their own or together as members of a collaborative squad. Players can upgrade their spacecraft in various ways, including adding weapons, engines, shields, and other modifications and upgrades.

Source: Wikipedia, "Jumpgate: The Reconstruction Initiative", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106327.name: Armor Mayhem
106327.description:
User Summary

An action shooter game, with platform elements. You also have the ability to go into slow motion.
A fairly involved flash game, offers user generated maps for example, or fight on the traditional maps. You can upgrade weapons and armor as you play.

106328.name: Action Buggy
106328.description:
User Summary

Pilot your moon buggy over dangerous terrain, blowing up obstacles or jumping over them.

106329.name: Action Hero
106329.description:
User Summary

Battle gangsters as you fight your way down the roof of the train. Beware of dynamite and telephone poles.

106331.name: Babies Dream of Dead Worlds
106331.description:
User Summary

A different platformer/action game. You control an insect type creature. You can jump and walk back and forth, and force yourself higher or lower in midair. The gravity will sometimes flip so that you walk on the ceiling, or equalize so you float, avoid the spikes!

106332.name: Bricks of Camelot
106332.description:
User Summary

A classic brick breaking game taken into the fantastical realm of Camelot. Activate spells with your ball or summon eagles to aid your efforts.

106333.name: Comet Racer
106333.description:
User Summary

Race through abandoned mining asteroids. Discover secret passages and power ups. Comet Racer has you manuver through a winding maze of tunnels as fast as you can. Race against your shadow to try and improve your score.

106334.name: Mexiball
106334.description:
User Summary

Roll and sort the colored balls on each level to make them explode.

106335.name: Barbarian Onslaught: The Secret of Steel
106335.description:
User Summary

A straight-forward beat em up style game. There is an inventory of different moves that can be undertaken. Try to kill the enemies before they kill you.

106336.name: Monkey Flight
106336.description:
User Summary

Use a palm tree to launch your monkey into the air to collect fruit. You can bounce off elephants but beware the landing.

106337.name: Paracute
106337.description:
User Summary

Guide your teddy bear safely down the hole to land on the pillow.

106338.name: Top Hat Willy
106338.description:
Top Hat Willy is a platform computer game created by Tero Heikkinen for the Commodore Amiga and was released in 1994. The objective of the game is to collect 160 pieces of trash that are scattered around the 100 room gamplay area. The rooms are set up in a 10 x 10 grid, each room connecting to its four surrounding rooms. The player has 9 lives.

The game is based on the ZX Spectrum game Jet Set Willy.

Source: Wikipedia, "Top Hat Willy", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106339.name: Ruberth's Kick n' Fly
106339.description:
User Summary

What do elves do after work? The get launched by reindeer into the sky!

Launch your elf into the sky to collect candy and ornaments.

106340.name: Battle for Wayland Keep
106340.description:
User Summary

An action game that plays like an RTS, (you click on enemies you wish to fight, overhead view) you control a superhero fantasy legend called Argus. You have many powers that upgrade over time. The game has high production quality.

106341.name: Symple
106341.description:
Symple is an abstract strategy game in which two players strive to get as much area as possible with as few groups as possible.

Players alternate making a move. White plays with the white stones and makes the first move, Black plays with the black stones. On his turn, a player may choose either a) to place a stone on the board without contact to other stones of his color in order to start a new group, or b) to grow all possible groups by one stone. Stones touching two groups count as growing both groups. However, if two groups are grown by one stone each and only the two newly grown stones touch, then the move is legal.

For balancing, there is an extra rule: Black is allowed to grow all his groups and place a single stone as long as neither player has not yet grown any groups.

The game ends when the board is filled in. The score is determined by the number of stones each player has on the board minus 'P' times the number of groups he has, where 'P' is en even number of 4 or higher. With an even penalty and an odd boardsize, draws are not possible.

Symple is played on a square board, normally the 19x19 goban. The version on a hexhex board is called HexSymple.

Online Play


http://www.mindsports.nl/ - (turn-based)

106342.name: Zombie Massacre
106342.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Doom (1993).





Zombie Massacre (AKA Gloom 4) is a 1998 computer game for the Amiga computer. It was a clone of the immensely popular first person shooter Doom on the Amiga.Zombie Massacre's authors were proprietor of Alpha Software, Gareth Murfin, Dave Boaz, Dave Newton (coder), Frank Wille with graphics by James Caygill, Jason Jordache, Liam Weford, Slawomir Stascheck and music by William Morton (musician). The game was one of two games produced by Alpha Software for the Amiga, the other being Gloom 3, at a time when the machine was being squeezed out of the market.

Source: Wikipedia, "Zombie Massacre", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106343.name: Gloom 3
106343.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game is an unlicensed version of Doom (1993).





Gloom 3 (AKA Ultimate Gloom, AKA Gloom 3 : Zombie Edition) is a 1997 computer game for the Amiga computer.
Gloom 3 was the third proper, commercially released, clone of the immensely popular first person shooter Doom in the Gloom series on the Amiga.
Gloom 3's author was proprietor of Alpha Software, Gareth Murfin, with additional graphics by James Caygill and Jason Jordache
The game was one of two games produced by Alpha Software for the Amiga, the other being Zombie Massacre, at a time when the machine was being squeezed out of the market. Although the game was critically received by publications such as CU Amiga, games for the Amiga were on the decline and were not deemed commercially viable, and the game received criticism for its appearance.Source: Wikipedia, "Gloom 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106344.name: StarBlade
106344.description:
StarBlade (スターブレード, sutā burēdo) is a 3D space shoot 'em up arcade game that was released by Namco in 1991. It was later ported to the Mega-CD and 3DO in 1994. It was also released on the PlayStation as StarBlade Alpha in 1996.

The appearance of a "pod" in which the "gunner" controlled a double barrel laser cannon, was not a totally new concept in the arcades, but what was new was the method of how the image was "projected". The arcade version of StarBlade used a concave mirror (molded of black, reflective, and flexible plexi) to reflect the image of a 26" standard resolution monitor at the top of the simulator housing. This gave the player an experience of a deeper space environment which, with its lens like effect had never been seen in any video game at the time.

Source: Wikipedia, "StarBlade", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106345.name: Lupo Alberto: The Video Game
106345.description:
User Summary

The first video game featuring the Lupo Alberto (a wolf), a popular Italian comics character. The goal of the game is to find where he, and his girlfriend Maria (a hen, also a playable character), can express their forbidden love.

106347.name: Electric Box
106347.description:
It’s time to think outside the box.
Electric box is a unique styled puzzle game where you have to connect power from the power supply to the set target.

Source: The Game Website.

106348.name: Alien Shooter
106348.description:
From the developer's website:

The endless darkness and the somber, long passages of a military complex have become the abode of evil, as thousands of blood-thirsty creatures fill its offices, storehouses and mysterious laboratories.

Your mission is simple: clear the base at all costs. You will be provided with explosives to help you gain access to the teleports from where thousands of pitiless creatures pour. A stationary gun will aid in the defense of the area. You have been granted access to the most advanced weapons technology money can buy. As you earn your pay, you can equip yourself with additional weapons in the arming area and biomechanical implants that will make your fighting abilities super human.

The alien invasion has begun, we have one chance, and that is to stop them cold in their staging area. Do not allow them escape this facility, you are our last hope. The fate of humanity now depends on you!

106349.name: Alien Shooter: The Experiment
106349.description:
Day after day, the hope for human survival is fading.
Half of the Earth surface is inhabited by the monsters.
Now people have to dwell in specially made fortified
settlements. Here they live, work, study,
grow children and...
invent new ways to fight the aliens...

Now the leading scientists of Earth are working on creation of the new monster species, which should stop the invasion! Will the scientists succeed? Can their plans be realized, or this can cause even a larger disaster?

In the new part, you will find:

- 5 new missions
- new music tracks
- new type of monsters
- monster boss
- new objects

Also, after numerous customer requests, we have added ability to choose difficulty level. Now, after installng this add-on, you can select difficulty to match your skills.

Source: The Developer Website.

106350.name: SyGo
106350.description:
SyGo or Symple Go is a multi-move abstract strategy game for two players. There is a parallel to Go, because players try to control area with living groups. The goal of the game is to have more stones + enclosed areas on the board than the opponent at the end of the game.

The game follows the protocol of Symple. All placement and balancing rules of Symple apply. However, as opposed to Symple, capture is possible. A group is captured, if it has no liberties anymore. Captured stones are flipped as in Othello, meaning they change color. It is noteworthy that this kind of capture does not create liberties for the capturing group.

SyGo is usually played on a 19x19 square board.

Online Play


http://mindsports.nl/ - (turn-based)

106351.name: Alien Shooter: Fight for Life
106351.description:
2026 AD.

One year passed since aliens invaded planet Earth. These monsters have captured large districts of the Earth surface, and now all the humanity arises against them.

Among secret government research projects there’s a virus which can help people survive and avoid total annihilation.

You must get into the secret research-and-development center and save the virus. Yes, save the virus, because it’s in danger now...

In the new part of the game:

- 5 new missions, put together in a plot line
- vivid prehistory
- even larger crowds of monsters to wipe out before you reach the goal

Source: The Developer Website.

106352.name: Zombie Shooter
106352.description:
Where is the line between life and death?

How far can human science go trying to understand this?

Take part in the great battle to rescue humanity and find out what's happening!

The human race is in danger again. This time scientists could not cope the imminent threat and became monsters themselves. Crowds of zombie people filled the secret research base. The dreadful contagion is about to spread earthwide.

Use the last chance to save the humanity from total annihilation!

- fight your way through contaminated hordes
- use 10 types of weapons
- improve the character’s skills
- upgrade available arms with the money earned

In the end:
Find the answer to the main question - what caused the catastrophe?
Who knows, maybe on the final stage you'll face something terrible?..

Attention! Try your monster fighting skills in two new game modes -
Survive and Gun Stand. Only these modes will really show how good
you've become.

Source: The Developer Website.

106353.name: Alien Shooter: Revisited
106353.description:
Crowds of blood-thirsty monsters, crawling from every corner of the secret research base. Gloomy basements and modern labs, darkness changing into blazing bulbs. The only usual thing is: you're in a bad place alone, and there's no one to help you!

We have here an improved version of a cult 2003 game which won hearts of the huge army of players worldwide. Complete game missions, earning more and more cash for weapons and inventory, use stationary weapons in the hottest places, eliminate monster spawning places with dynamite and increase your firepower with implants and drones.

The renewed version of the game features:

- 10 game missions;
- 9 weapon types;
- 3 game modes;
- modern visual effects;
- upgrading with help of implants;
- buying additional gear.

You've saved our poor little planet so many times... but the real hero never stops!
Go ahead, great deeds are waiting for you!

Source: The Developer Website.

106354.name: Zombie Shooter 2
106354.description:
Zombie Shooter 2 is a unique blend of two game genres - Action and RPG. Every player can choose a character to the liking, get experience to develop skills, earn money and spend it at weapons, medications and useful devices. All of this will be used against thousands of enemies. The zombies fill the game screen, never letting you rest, even for a minute.

Imagine yourself coming to visit an unknown city and seeing it almost ruined, with all the citizens turned into zombies. What will you do? Call for help, orzanize a large-scale rescue campaign or... Try to dig your way out of the situation, find out what happened and use your last chance to save the person you love!

- New project from the maker of the legendary Alien Shooter series.
- Huge crowds of enemies, more than 100 zombies on one map at a time.
- Ability to upgrade the main character's parameters.
- More than 60 weapon types, including sniper rifles.
- Lots of auxiliary devices, including radar and battle drones.
- Several types of vehicles to drive.
- Three game types: Campaign, Survive, Gun Stand.

Source: The Developer Website.

106355.name: Thunder Truck Rally
106355.description:
Thunder Truck Rally (Known as Monster Trucks in Europe) is a monster truck racing game developed by Reflections where players select a monster truck or otherwise 4X4 vehicle equipped with monster truck tires and have the option of either racing or crushing cars in an arena.

Players start with an array of options from choosing their game mode to choosing their race track. If a player chooses to race, they are faced with innumerous outdoor tracks, all of which feature various hills, bends and turns. The players must maintain careful driving however as every vehicle has a strength meter which measures the vehicle’s engine strength; if a player lands too hard from a jump their engine will receive damage.

Source: Wikipedia, "Thunder Truck Rally", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106356.description:
From the designer and Kickstarter project page:

"Borogove is a card game based off Lewis Carroll's Alice's Adventures in Wonderland and Through the Looking Glass, And What Alice Found There. It was first seen in the pages of Skin Deep, with a Jub Jub Bird and a Bandersnatch playing the card game. At the time I just threw some words from Jabberwocky into the dialog to make it seem like a weird, fun game. Many readers expressed interest in actually playing Borogove, so I sat down and started to create a game. Now I want to print it so everyone can play and enjoy!"

The game comprises a deck of 52 cards of 13 suits, each suit having 4 cards each. Players play cards in an attempt to match either the suit of a card or a value of a card (Uno-like).
106356.name: Borogove

106357.name: Twinkle Tale
106357.description:
User Summary

You play as Saria, a witch trying to free her land from the grip of an evil demon. She has three weapons, each of which can be levelled up by collecting stars , and two types of special attack at her disposal. The gameplay is similar to that of mercs in that Saria moves around the screen shooting her weapons in the direction she faces.

106358.name: Arcade Snooker
106358.description:
User Summary

Arcade Snooker is a simple yet surprisingly accurate snooker simulation. The view is top down and the snooker rules are fully recreated. There are plenty of computer opponents named after members of Team17 and Amiga Power magazine Staff, as well as a two player mode.

106359.name: Black Hole Assault
106359.description:
In Single Player Mode, players fight eight different Akirovian giant robots in eight levels spanning throughout the Solar System using one of two C.A.M.'s (Cybernetic Anthropomorphized Machines), either the Cyquest or the Orion.Each battle between the player and enemy takes place over one round, and the player only has five continues should they lose a single match. Each battle is timed, and once the timer runs out the player's C.A.M. would self-destruct.

Source: Wikipedia, "Black Hole Assault", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106360.name: Bio Assault
106360.description:
User Summary

A shoot em up with some twists, permanently increase the power of some of the ships attributes. Unlike most shootemups, power ups gained in the levels don't last until you die, rather for a short period of time. Another twist is that your ship has a power bar, rather than one hit destroying it.

106361.name: Robo Aleste
106361.description:
The plot of the game refers to feudal Japan being given giant mecha, the player being the pilot of one such mecha, the Aleste, fighting against the other feudal lords. In the game itself the plot is not referred to at all.
Robo Aleste follows the traditional vertically scrolling shooter style, with the player flying forward and enemies coming from the front, sides, and rear. At the end of each level is a boss, which the player must defeat in order to move on. Each boss is one of the warlords allied against Nobunaga. Like most scrolling shooters, there are several weapons which can be collected and powered up.

Source: Wikipedia, "Robo Aleste", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106362.name: Black Ops Korean Conflict
106362.description:
User Summary

A run and gun game where you have to find ammo before you can be very effective. Set apparently on the Korean peninsula, each level has it's own objectives.

106363.name: Race to Smurf Village
106363.description:
In the Race to Smurf Village game each player has to select a card, which will tell you what color space to move to next. A Smurf berry or apple card can move you further ahead, However, a Gargamel card will send you back in the game. The winner is the first player to get to Smurf Village.

Includes:
- Gameboard
- Cards
- 4 Smurf themed movers
- 4 Mover stands
- Rule booklet

106364.name: Blood Car! 2000!
106364.description:
User Summary

Drive your car through multiple levels, attempting to splatter as many pedestrians as you can along the way.

106365.name: Blue Knight
106365.description:
User Summary

A beat em up, fighting game, with action rpg elements where you can gain levels. Special weapons can be used, you hold one at a time, they use crystals. You also have the ability to block attacks with your shield.

106366.name: Bluep
106366.description:
User Summary

A very difficult shooting game, requires a high level of coordination. You must aim your weapon at opponents, fire your weapon each shot individually, and jump over lasers that cut across the screen on occasion. All done with simple geometric shapes, and minimalistic palette presentation.

106367.name: Bobulous
106367.description:
User Summary

You are a sphere on a circular plate. You want to collide with smaller spheres, while avoiding larger. Once you have hit enough smaller spheres, you have the opportunity to increase the size of your own sphere. There are also additional features such as bombs to clear enemies in the vicinity.

106368.name: Boss Bash
106368.description:
UNLICENSED GAME




This game uses unlicensed Nintendo Co., Ltd. characters.




User Summary

Take on the final bosses from Final Fight, Legend of Zelda II and Super Mario bros 2. You can try multiple times against each boss to perform better, and improve your skills.

106369.name: Battalion Commander
106369.description:
From the back of the box:

As a lieutenant colonel in charge of an entire armored battalion, you must issue swift and decisive commands. This decisiveness is especially critical in an exciting real-time tactical game like BATTALION COMMANDER. Here's your chance to match wits against the computer in a series of conflicts designed to test your military prowess.

You can choose from five different scenarios. In the novice game, your objective is to destroy a Soviet tank battalion while learning the ropes of command. The tougher assignments include such missions as overwhelming an enemy whose defenses have been disrupted or dealing with an unexpected enemy encounter.

Your forces are equipped with a complete arsenal of modern vehicles and weapons such as tanks, APC's, howitzers, heavy mortars, antitank missiles and assault guns.

You can select the nationality of ground forces (U.S., Soviet, or Chinese) for either your side or the enemy's. Relative strengths can also be adjusted to vary the difficulty of the game. And if you get bored with the scenery, just choose another battleground from the 40 terrain maps available.

By David Hille

106370.name: Bounty Killers (2008)
106370.description:
User Summary

An overhead shooter, enemies come in waves. Try to shoot and kill enemies, while avoiding enemy fire. Think arcade rather than simulation.

106371.name: Bowmaster Prelude
106371.description:
User Summary

A tower defense game meets angry bird. Control your archer in much the same fashion as you would play angry birds to eliminate the hoards of enemies attacking your castle.

106372.name: Boxhead: The Zombie Wars
106372.description:
User Summary

An overhead view shooter, two versions. One survive wave after wave of zombies on your own, with nothing but weapons as you gather them. In the second you begin the game with a barricade and a number of high powered weapons. You have the ability to upgrade this area as time goes on, and to get out and do some killing yourself. You will need to leave the security of the base to collect weapons as they fall, or your base will be steadily demolished, and you will lack resources to rebuild.

106373.name: Bismarck: The North Sea Chase
106373.description:
From the back of the box:

Germany's massive dreadnaught, Bismarck, sent Her Majesty's Ship Hood to the bottom of the icy Atlantic on the evening of 24 May 1941. Of the Hood's 1,415 crewmen, only 3 survived. Bismarck's guns are powerful enough to hurl automobile-sized shells for miles. With such awesome firepower, can she invincibly prowl the sea lanes? Can Britain stop her?

Bismarck - The North Sea Chase is a taut, multi-level game featuring full joystick control; real-time action; and variable speed and difficulty levels. You're in charge of an exciting array of technical controls: Main Screen Map, Air Reconnaissance Screen, Weather Forecasting, Radar Search, Bridge Command and more!

And when it's time for action, you direct the anti-aircraft and heavy guns; launch torpedo attacks; and manage damage control! If you tire of command from the bridge, you can pilot a Fairey Swordfish torpedo plane off a carrier flight deck. Hunt Bismarck from the air via this exciting, cockpit-perfect flight simulator. With options to control either The Royal Navy or the infamous German battleship, Bismarck - The North Sea Chase provides and abundance of intriguing, sharp-edged game play.

106374.name: Brawl Royale
106374.description:
User Summary

A quickdraw game. You must hit space bar shortly after you see the GO, or you will lose. The time you have to respond is reduced as the game progresses. Also a two player game, with the same gameplay, second player uses enter.

106375.name: Broadsides
106375.description:
From the back of the box:

BROADSIDES is a game of non-stop naval action, as fast and demanding as the historical battles it recreates: Constitution vs. Guerriere, Bonhomme Richard vs. Serapis, and many more. In this two-player and solitaire simulation, both ships will be rigged, manned, and armed just like the real ships were, and will handle in the wind just as the real ships sailed.

For speed of play, the ARCADE game lets you sail right into the action. You set your course, maneuver and fire broadsides as fast as your crew can reload. For authenticity and historical detail, the TACTICAL game puts you on the quarterdeck. There, you make decisions real captains had to make: How much sail? What course for best speed? Aim your guns for the rigging or waterline? What range? Load with solid shot or grape shot?

When the ships move within grappling range, your boarding parties and sharpshooters will decide the battle. As you watch the action on your screen, you'll take a saber in hand and plunge into the heart of the fight.

If you wish to depart from the historical ships provided and design your own naval legends, BROADSIDES lets you build frigates and ships-of-the-line from the keel up, rigging them, manning them, and arming them with everything from 12-pounders to hull-smashing carronades.

By Wayne Garris

106376.name: The Chessmaster 2000
106376.description:
From the back of the box:

It draws from a mammoth opening library of over 71,000 moves -- the world's largest. In mid-game, it displays amazing combinations of classical and modern strategy. At end game it calls further upon the world's newest and finest computer chess algorithm to mount virtuoso tactics. The Chessmaster 2000 is the perfect champion chess companion, adversary and instructor for chess enthusiasts of all ages and skills.

106377.name: Traffic Rush
106377.description:
User Summary

Traffic Rush has you controlling the flow of traffic at a busy intersection or now in a rail yard. stop the traffic or accellerate it to ensure that no one crashes.

106378.name: Spikey's Bounce Around
106378.description:
User Summary

Help Spikey free the butterflies trapped on each level. You have a limited number of shots to save them all.

106379.name: Titanic Rescue
106379.description:
User Summary

Save the doomed passengers of the Titanic. Get them into your life boats. Take too long and they'll start to jump. If you match colors you get bonus points.

106380.name: Kenny Dalglish Soccer Manager
106380.description:
Kenny Dalglish Soccer Manager (also known as Kenny Dalglish's Soccer Manager) is a football computer game that involves taking the role of Kenny Dalglish as he manages an English football team from the Football League Fourth Division right to the Football League First Division. By 1989, Dalglish was hardly playing for Liverpool F.C. anymore so a computer game had to be made in order to adapt to his new role as a manager. Dalglish eventually would retire from the athletic aspect of professional football after the May 9, 1990 game between Liverpool and Derby County F.C.. As of May 12, 2011, Dalglish is again permanent manager for the same Liverpool team that he became famous for playing with.
The game is a spiritual successor to the original computer game Football Manager (referring to the original 1982 series; not the revised 2005 series).

The game is powered mainly by icons and menus; dragging the "managerial football" genre into the 1990s. A chairman can be consulted if players made the right decision while a physiotherapist can check for player injuries and the football scout can find players that can be recruited into the team. Match highlights can be either enable or disabled; but the results tell the identical story as the highlights.

Source: Wikipedia, "Kenny Dalglish Soccer Manager", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106381.name: Showcase Snooker
106381.description:
From the Developer's Website:

In the world of Showcase Snooker, you're the up-coming contender. Play against a range of computerised players in a variety of locations. Keep cool under pressure as the tension mounts and the captive audience falls silent. You steady your aim, the frames are equal, the scores are level, potting the black ball will see you crowned champion.

Play in a number of exotic locations, wonder at the skills of the people who transported the table there, and dream of chance to play snooker on a tropical isle.

Reliance on a steady hand, and an eye for the shot are essential, a sneeze at the wrong time could spell disaster.

106382.name: Banzuke Shoushin
106382.description:
Banzuke Shoushin (番付昇進 'Rise through the ranks of sumo') is - as the name already indicates - a sumo wrestling career simulation game. Hence, it does not focus on individual bouts (even though hundreds of fights are simulated during the game), but on the whole of a rikishi's (sumo wrestler) career.

There are 12 rikishi in the game, but only a small number of those are player-controled; the others are 'automated', i.e. controled by the game. The game is intended to be played by a very small number of players or solitaire. In principle it could work with up to 6, but it is recommended for 2 or 3 players.

During a single game year, rikishi first train, which means that they improve their skills in 1 or 2 of 5 different areas of skill (endurance, strength, weight (yes, that's a skill here...), speed, technique). In the meanwhile their oyakata (stable masters, comp. coaches) try to improve their spirits, which works like a 6th skill.

After training the basho (tournament) begins. A whole year of sumo (6 basho) is condensed into a single tournament (of 45 bouts) in the game. Every bout is decided by the match tactic and a number of dice. Rikishi can try to influence the match tactic such that it matches their strongest skills (or the opponent's weaknesses).

After the basho the banzuke (ranking) is adjusted, rikishi age one year, and some retire (forcibly or voluntarily).

Playing one game year takes about 45 to 60 minutes, most of which is taken up by the tournament. Consequently, simulating a 10-year sumo career will take up to 10 hours. It is, however, easy to store away the game in between years, and thus to play the game in many different sessions spread out over a longer period of time.

106383.name: Black & White 2: Battle of the Gods
106383.description:
Black & White 2: Battle of the Gods is an expansion pack for Lionhead's Black & White 2, in which the player is pitted against an enemy god for the first time. The expansion adds a number of additional miracles to the game, including the ability to resurrect dead citizens or transform corpses into undead soldiers. Two additional creatures make an appearance, although neither is new to the franchise; a tortoise, seen in the original Black & White, and the tiger from the Collector's Edition of Black & White 2.

Source: Wikipedia, "Black & White 2: Battle of the Gods", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106384.name: Apprentice
106384.description:
From the back of the box:

Apprentice is an exciting and challenging arcade jump'n'run game with many puzzles containing:

- Lots of levels (some hidden)
- Heaven and hell, land and air, fire and water levels
- A password system
- Information points, shops and fairy princesses
- Opponents that also use your weapons as well as theirs
- Lots of different weapons and features: crates, balloons, platforms, treasure chests, thorns and a little brother
- Multi-directional scrolling with high-resolution graphics

106385.name: Black & White: Creature Isle
106385.description:
Black & White: Creature Isle is an expansion pack for the PC game Black & White by Lionhead Studios. This expansion pack focuses on the creature and there are no levels as there were in the original game. It is played as a separate game, and presents several main differences from the original Black & White game.
The story of this game involves the player controlling his or her creature (either a new one or the creature they used in Black & White) and completing missions, which are given to the player by members of a Brotherhood. The members are all creatures that are not controlled by a god, and they all wear bracelets to show their membership in this Brotherhood. Once the player completes a mission, they can then fight the creature that gave them the mission or choose to fight that creature again or use that creature at will. Once the player has successfully completed all the missions and won all the fights, they will be able to see Eve and have a baby pet for their creature. The player's pet will then have a pet, which can help both the creature and the player. Also, there is the speed miracle, though no skirmishes included in the game carry it. It can be used to get past various trials more easily. If the player does not have a creature of certain height, the creature will be enlarged. It will also automatically know the three basic spells (food, water, and wood). The default creature for newly created profiles in Creature Isle is the Ape.

Source: Wikipedia, "Black & White: Creature Isle", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106386.name: Dungeon Keeper: The Deeper Dungeons
106386.description:
User Summary

The Deeper Dungeons is an expansion to Dungeon Keeper. It features 15 new single player missions, 15 multiplayer missions, improved AI and improved graphics.

106387.name: Dungeon Keeper: Gold Edition
106387.description:
User Summary

Dungeon Keeper: Gold Edition is a compilation of Dungeon Keeper (with 3D graphics patches) and its expansion: The Deeper Dungeons. Also included is level editing software.

106388.name: Battle Realms: Winter of the Wolf
106388.description:
Battle Realms: Winter of the Wolf is the expansion pack of the real-time strategy computer game Battle Realms.

The story begins with Grayback, the last heir to the Wolf clan's throne, explaining that long ago that life was better for their clan before the storms came and drowned their paradise. They were saved from death by their druidess order using their clan's most sacred treasure the white wolf's skull, given to them by their clan's totem, the white wolf.

The skull guided them to the lands of the Serpent empire where their new neighbors the Serpent and Lotus clan welcomed them as allies but unfortunately they trusted them.Thinking that their lives seemed simple and good again little did they know that Lord Zymeth of the Lotus clan made a deal with the Serpent emperor and attacked them by surprise. The Serpent clan looked away as the Lotus burned their towns and killed their people, many wolvesmen tried to fight back but were unsuccessful, the survivors of the battle became slaves in the Lotus shale mines, ever since then Grayback trained his fellow miners in the arts of war, led them to rebellion and struggle for freedom from the grip of their slave master Mistress Yvaine.

Source: Wikipedia, "Battle Realms: Winter of the Wolf", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106389.name: Zoids Densetsu
106389.description:
Densetsu is a Game Boy game, released in Japan(DMG-ZOJ) and China(DMG-123 CHN). The game is set during Century Zero, the main battle/war between two rival nations: the Helic Republic and Zenebas Empire. Their main weapons are Zoids and the battle/war takes place on Planet Zi.

The Zenebas Zoids were mostly red and silver and more armored, the Helic more skeletal and favoring blue and grey, it is your duty to either choose the side of Good(Helic Republic) or Evil(Zenebas Empire) and finally decide the end of the battle/war.
(In real time, Helic Republic wins and the Zenebas Empire disbands then later reforms as the Guylos Empire.)
Time to choose... Zoids of the Empire: Iron Kong, Death Saurer and Great Saber Zoids of the Republic: Shield Liger, Mad Thunder, and Gojulas.

Once you have chosen, you begin the battle/war against the opposing side and fight until the end of the war, facing tons of enemies and bosses in an attempt to win.

Source: Wikipedia, "List of Zoids video games", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106390.name: The Fellowship of the Ring

videogamehonor.29174: 1986 Golden Joystick Best Adventure Game of the Year Nominee

106390.description:
From Wikipedia: Lord of the Rings: Game One (released in North America as The Fellowship of the Ring Software Adventure) is a computer game released in 1985 and based on the book The Fellowship of the Ring, by J. R. R. Tolkien. It was the follow-up to the 1982 game The Hobbit, although did not reach the same level of critical and commercial success as its predecessor, and is considered inferior by the gaming community, with many complaining about the removal of the real-time aspects and complex AI patterns of the previous game, and puzzles that lacked coherent solutions.

Source: Wikipedia, "Lord of the Rings: Game One," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106391.name: Aquaventura
106391.description:
From the back of the box:

The rumours have been rife!
Expectations have run high!
For four years computer game players have been awaiting this, the release of the decade. Now, be still your beating heart, for here is...

Aquaventura

Battling against a powerful enemy race, you and your one-man ship must fight through eight danger zones, each swarming with alien things. The zones are connected by a tunnel which you must skilfully navigate avoiding or destroying patrolling enemy craft. Make it through the tunnel and you are rewarded with energy and weapon replenishment ready for your battle in teh next zone.
Featuring superbly animated, filled polygons expertly combined with impressive 3D sprites, Aquaventura breaks new ground and proves to be well worth the wait.
Aquaventura: The damp patch in your software collection.

106392.name: Thieves'  World Gift Set
106392.description:
From the "back cover"

Thieves' World has enthralled fantasy fans for over 25 years and now you can join the adventures! This slipcase includes everything you need to have exciting roleplaying adventures in the original shared world using the d20 system. The set includes the four original Thieves' World titles from Greeen Ronin: The Thieves' World Player's Manual, Shadowspawn's Guide to Sanctuary, Murder at the Vulgar Unicorn, and the Thieves' World Gazetteer. It also includes a brand new adventure, Black Snake Dawn, which takes place during Sanctuary's classic era. Together these five books give you a complete look at the Thieves' World setting and reveal many previously unknown details of its history and personalities. There's even a new short story by Lynn Abbey herself! The Thieves' World Gift Set is something no Thieves' World fan will want to be without.

user summary

the five books are:

Black Snake Dawn
Murder at the Vulgar Unicorn
Shadowspawn's Guide to Sanctuary
Thieves' World Companion
Thieves' World Player's Manual

106393.name: Robo Pit
106393.description:
Robo Pit is a robot fighting game released in 1996 for PlayStation and Sega Saturn. The game was developed by Altron and published by Kokopeli Digital Studios outside Japan. A sequel, Robo Pit 2, was released in Japan on PlayStation in 1997 and 2003 in Europe and North America.
The rules are, build a robot and then try to fight your way to the top in arenas that are square in shape. There are many different types of arenas and the time of day can vary.
There are various types of weapons which include The Axe, Lips, Sword, Missile and Claws as well as many more. As you fight your way to the top there are bosses you will fight along the way.

Source: Wikipedia, "Robo Pit", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106394.name: Robo Pit 2
106394.description:
User Summary

Robo Pit 2 is a robot fighting game where one or two players go head to head with robots and try to destroy each other. This is the sequel to Robo Pit.

106395.name: Stronghold: Crusader – Extreme
106395.description:
User Summary

Stronghold Crusader Extreme is basically a buffed up version of the original Stronghold Crusader. The most significant feature is that a player can now have up to 10,000 units on the playing field at a time. It also includes 30 new stand alone maps that can be played in multiplayer or single player skirmish. It also includes a brand new Crusader trail- the Crusader Extreme trail - A heavy duty, 20 mission trail that will test the nerves of even the most hardened ‘Stronghold Crusader’ expert! This new trail also includes the 8 new A.I. opponents: The Wazir, The Marshal, The Emir, The Abbot and The Nizar.

106396.name: Darkest Hour: A Hearts of Iron Game
106396.description:
Developed by a team of experienced modders from the Paradox forum, Darkest Hour is a stand-alone Hearts of Iron game featuring a mixture of short and in-depth campaigns set across the darkest chapters of the 20th century, from the outbreak of the Great War up to the onset of the Cold War. Darkest Hour will introduce a new artificial intelligence that is now able to react to hundreds of different situations simultaneously, along with a dynamic diplomatic system that will allow the player to have a real impact on the course of history.

Source: The Publisher Website.

106397.name: Europa Universalis III: Chronicles
106397.description:
Unparalleled in its depth and historical accuracy, Europa Universalis gives players the freedom to rule any nation from an impressive choice of over 250 countries. Europa Universalis III: Chronicles also brings the expansion packs Heir to the Throne and Divine Wind to retail shelves for the first time, deepening the experience and extending an already robust playing time.

Source: The Publisher Website.

106398.name: Brink of Alienation
106398.description:
User Summary

You are a on Mars. As you return home, you get a strange message, it seems aliens are enslaving the earth's population of humans! You are the only one who can save humanity! Run, jump and shoot your way to freedom, and save humans from annihilation.

106399.name: Brink of Alienation II
106399.description:
User Summary

Continues the story of the man returning from Mars to fight intergalactic aliens. This time on the icy moon Europa. Run, jump and shoot your way to freedom!

106400.name: Dreamlords: Resurrection
106400.description:
Dreamlords: Resurrection is a unique online game that combines elements from both Massively Multiplayer Online Games (MMOG) and Real-Time Strategy (RTS). Victory requires long-term planning as well as quick thinking in intense real-time battles waged against the computer and other players.

As a semi-divine Dreamlord, it falls to you to inspire and lead a band of struggling followers to found a strong and thriving city. Then, conquer new lands, defend against the Nightmares that roam the wilderness, and forge alliances with other newly-awakened Dreamlords.

In your struggles against monsters and other players, you will research new troop types and technologies, gather resources, and acquire and craft equipment for yourself and your army. And if you wish, you may pay Tribute to the gods, that you might receive their divine gifts and blessings, and that their wrath may rain down upon your enemies.

Source: The Publisher Website.

106402.name: Woody Two-Legs: Attack of the Zombie Pirates
106402.description:
Meet Woody Two-Legs, the least infamous pirate of the Seven Seas. Things have never gone quite right for Woody. That is, until he scored big time and got his hands on a huge treasure. Sailing to a remote island, Woody was about to bury his treasure, just as any good pirate would do. Unfortunately, it turned out that the original owners of the treasure, namely Mr. Jones himself and his retinue of undead pirates, had caught up with Woody. Small he might be, but Woody Two-Legs was not going to give up without a fight. Help Woody to fight wave after wave of undead pirates, defeat deadly bosses, collect bonuses and use devastating special weapons. All legs on deck!

Woody Two-Legs is a casual score chasing arcade shooter that offers players various degrees of unlockable difficulties, building gradually on intensity with wave after wave of attack by the retinue of undead pirates and their unholy allies. Part of the addiction lies in the fact that these enemies become increasingly nasty as the player unlocks the various difficulty modes, ultimately facing up against the man himself in the ultimate boss fight in Nightmare Mode.

Source: The Publisher Website.

106403.name: Brink of Alienation: Substance
106403.description:
User Summary

Brink of Alienation takes a turn toward the third person shooter. Make use of the ability to use cover. Shoot the terrorists before they shoot you. Be careful with your energy cells, and shoot the health container if you need it.

106404.name: The Kings' Crusade
106404.description:
The crowned heads of Europe have launched a new military campaign to reconquer the Holy Land.

The time has come for you to assemble your armies and take back the land as Richard the Lionheart, or to assume the role of heir to the great Saladin and defend your people against the oncoming invasion. Control and upgrade the leaders and their armies and lead your men into fierce battles in this real-time strategy game that places you in the era of the Third Crusade.

Source: The Publisher Website.

106405.name: Brink of Alienation III
106405.description:
User Summary

Humanity must be on the rebound, because in this edition of Brink of Alienation, the battle has been taken to the alien homeworld. Run jump and shoot your way to freedom, and kill them before they kill you!

106406.name: Hearts of Iron II: Iron Cross
106406.description:
Experience Hearts of Iron II like never before with the Iron Cross expansion.

Wage war on a new map throughout 4,000 new provinces, in new scenarios, and over an extended timeline spanning from 1933 to 1964, allowing you to lead your nation in pre- and post-war periods.

Through thousands of historical events, command new units and brigades against a remarkable AI, enhancing your tactical prowess with a spectacular new technology tree.

Lead one of more than 200 nations as you interact with real leaders and ministers for unparalleled depth.

You've never seen anything like this. It's time to rediscover Hearts of Iron II.

Source: The Publisher Website.

106407.name: Dragon Slayer (Issue 4)
106407.description:
Table of Contents

4 - Random Encounters
6 - Laboratory of Doctor Bald The Bald has published a RPG
8 - Sir Holland The most complicated knight strikes again
10 - Review National RPG
13 - Classics Tales of the Lance, best book of Dragonlance
14 - Preview 4D&T
18 - Deep Gate Haunted ship threats Deep Gate
20 - Amazone Prestige Class
22 - Familiars Why only wizards?
26 - Musashi The history of the famous samurai
28 - Arthur King of Celts
34 - Boss Demoniac Harpy
36 - New Race Aggelus and Sulfure
42 - Realm's News Latests News
48 - Fullmetal Alchemist New class and magics
54 - Dragon's Bride Comics

106408.name: Elven Legacy Collection
106408.description:
User Summary

A compilation of Elven Legacy and its three expansions.

106409.name: Brink of Alienation IV
106409.description:
User Summary

It's not completely clear where the battle is taking place in this installment of the Brink of Alienation series, but don't let get in the way of killing some alien scum! The controls are markedly different this time around, use the mouse to aim, and walk wherever you want while shooting.

106410.name: Brink of Alienation IV: Part Two
106410.description:
User Summary

The second half of Brink of Alienation IV! Run, shoot and jump your way to freedom! And kill them before they kill you!

106411.name: Internet Backgammon
106411.description:
User Summary

Internet Backgammon is a backgammon game included with Windows 7. You can play online against other human opponents or play against computer opponents.

106412.name: Internet Checkers
106412.description:
User Summary

Internet Checkers is a checkers game included with Windows 7. You can play against other people over the internet or you can play against computer opponents.

106413.name: Internet Spades
106413.description:
User Summary

Internet Spades is a spades game included with Windows 7. You can play against other people over the internet or you can play against computer opponents.

106414.name: Legio
106414.description:
Legio is a turn-based strategy game for one to two players. The game takes place in a mythical fantasy world where magicians, warriors, and monsters battle for domination. Playing Legio is an intense experience, requiring careful strategic thinking, rewarding both courage and cleverness!

The game is a mix between chess and a turn-based war game. Both players control an equal army of characters, with the goal of eliminating the other player's army. A game of Legio consists of two battles. The first takes place on the drawbridge and the second inside one of the two castle battlegrounds.

Source: The Publisher Website.

106415.name: Infectonator
106415.description:
User Summary

Infectonator is a browser-based strategy game where your goal is to spread a zombie-like infection. You do this by clicking on groups of people to infect them and create and small number of zombies, who will then seek out other people to infect. You can collect coins to purchase upgrades and items that will help you spread the infection.

106416.name: Infectonator: World Dominator
106416.description:
User Summary

Infectonator: World Dominator is a browser-based strategy game from Toge Production. Like the other games in the Infectonator series, your goal is to spread a zombie-like infection. New to this game is the ability to spread the infection to locations all over the planet.

106417.name: Safety First
106417.description:
Card game consisting of 52 cards featuring 5 sets of eight Citizen cards and four sets of three Vehicle Cards.

Shuffle them together then deal out an equal number of cards per player and everyone places their cards face-down in a pile in front of them. The game is played a little like Snap, but with a twist. As players reveal a card in their turn, "Safety First" must be called if two exposed cards match each other. However, if a vehicle card is exposed on any players' stack, then "Safety First" cannot be called, as the 'street' has a vehicle on it.

Players are urged to learn their Kerb Drill slogan;
Halt at the kerb.
Eyes right, Eyes left, Eyes right again
If the road is clear, quick march.

It is interesting that this advice was on children's TV 50 years later. Same advice but rebranded as the Green Cross Code.

Citizen cards illustrated by Harry Rowntree, the brilliant children's book artist. I have never come across any other game with a Harry Rowntree credit. NOTE: The artist was Harry Rountree but Jaques spelt it wrong on the box of this game. Now he is known with the Jaques spelling on some internet sites but Wikipedia confirms the correct spelling.

106418.name: Infectonator: Christmas Edition
106418.description:
User Summary

Infectonator: Christmas Edition is a christmas-themed remake of the game Infectonator. Like to original game, your goal is to spread a zombie-like infection by selectively infecting small groups of people who then turn into zombies and infect others. This game has Christmas-themed environments, music and characters.

106419.name: SimCity Societies: Destinations
106419.description:
The main focus of SimCity Societies: Destinations is tourism, with new features that allow players to build tourist destinations. Destinations that can be created by the player include ski resorts, beach resorts, and theme parks. Air travel and water travel have also been introduced to the game, along with an improved map generator.

Source: Wikipedia, "SimCity: Societies," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106420.name: Salute!
106420.description:
Fast and furious card game.
There are 52 cards in four suits of service personnel. The four services are The Royal Navy, The Army, The Royal Air Force, and The Women's Auxiliary Territorial Services.
Deal out all the cards after shuffling. Each player does not look at their cards but makes a face-down pile in front of him. At the start players turn over their top card as fast as they can. Any number 1 card is placed in the middle of the table. From then on, you can earn 'Promotion' by playing a number 2 card of the same suit, then a number 3 card, and so on. The cards in the middle must be the right service to gain 'promotion', but you can also discard a card on any other player's face-up pack, obeying the promotion rule of the next highest card, but as it is not promoting a card in the middle of the table, any promotion card, regardless of suit can be played.
Play should be fast, because there are many penalty card laws and the rules say "The fun of the game relies on penalties being enforced".
The first player to get rid of all his cards is the winner.
The cards feature the insignia of rank in each of the four services. There is also a number in the corner of the cards so if you do not know the ranking, you can just remember to play the next higher card in that service.
The box exhorts players "Learn to spot the ranks".
This is a patriotic game in that players, especially children, were very interested in all things military. I would date the game as 1918 because the RAF (Royal Air Force) didn't exist before April that year. Previously it was the RFC (Royal Flying Corps)

106421.name: Sam
106421.description:
Card game with 48 cards in four suits of 12. Cards are played with the aim to acheive a total divisible by 4.
The suits are;
S = Subtraction
A = Addition
M = Multiplication
SAM = any of the above
The last card played is all that affects the current card being played. For example; The first card played (which cannot score points) is a 3. The next player could play an A5 (A for Addition) he adds 5 to 3 to make 8. This is two 'Fours' made, score two points. The next player could play S4. 4 from 8 = 4, so one 'Four' created, scores 1 point. Next player plays a SAM 8. He scores 3 points for Additions (8 + 4 = 12, so 3 Fours made) but as it is a Sam card he can also score for Multiplication (4 x 8 = 32, so 8 points scored). In this example, Subtraction would score nothing. You can see that SAM cards are very valuable.
The first player to score 100 points, wins.
The rules refer to the cards as 'Blocks' and the intention was to make a more substantial version with the cards being replaced as tiles (called Blocks) but this never happened, possibly because The Great War started and materials were limited because of the war effort in industry.

106422.name: Dance of the Sun and Moon
106422.description:
From the front of the book:

The orbit of Toril’s moon often brings it across the sun's path, but astrological predictions of an upcoming total eclipse have sparked great interest. Many followers of Amaunator and Selûne have gathered at the small city of Sapra in the land of Turmish, the best place from which to view the eclipse. The worshippers of the Moonmaiden see this as a time of celebration, with their Lady ascendant, while those who revere the Sunlord are less enthusiastic about the celestial conjunction. But it is the followers of a different entity, guided by maddening whispers, who prepare to enact a far different ritual when the earth darkens and stars shine at midday. A Living Forgotten Realms adventure set in Westgate and Turmish for characters of the Heroic tier (levels 1-10).

106423.name: Feudal Endeavour: Fields & Fenceposts
106423.description:
England, 1073. You are the Reeve of a Feudal Manor. Compete against other Reeves for farmland while dealing with Blights, The Plague and the occasional Flood. The Objective of Feudal Endeavour: Fields & Fenceposts is to plant as many Fields of Crops as possible in order to have the largest harvest, gaining bonuses from Field size and proximity to water.
On their turn each player may play one to five Crop Cards or an Action Card from their hand following the instructions on the Card. When Crop Cards are played either a tile is placed on the board whose value is equal to the number of Crop Cards played or number of tiles whose total value is equal.
The game board is a 14 in. diameter circle with a smaller circle inside used for 2-3 player games.

106424.name: East India Company: Battle of Trafalgar
106424.description:
East India Company: Battle of Trafalgar recreates the legendary sea battle fought between the British Royal navy and the combined fleets of the French and Spanish navies during the height of the Napoleonic wars in late 1805.

Featuring historically accurate ships from all three fleets along with the key naval personnel of the battle, East India Company: Battle of Trafalgar is a simulation of what in reality was the most decisive British naval victory of the war.
Led by Admiral Lord Nelson aboard HMS Victory, an outnumbered British fleet sank 22 enemy vessels off of the South West coast of Spain without a single ship of their own being lost.

Source: The Publisher Website.

106425.name: East India Company: Privateer
106425.description:
Fans of East India Company will get the chance to experience the darker side of naval trading and combat with the upcoming expansion, East India Company: Privateer. Players will get to take on the role of a ruthless seafaring privateer, motivated solely by a thirst for fortune and holding allegiance only to those who will pay for their services.
Players will operate their own fleets, commanded by merchant or privateer captains, with the goal of accumulating as much wealth as possible and by any means necessary. Though it offers a limited
timeframe, Privateer is more mission-oriented than the original game, as players free of allegiances can embark upon such missions as smuggling, blockading ports, and hunting down ships bearing diplomatic envoys.

Source: The Publisher Website.

106426.name: East India Company Collection
106426.description:
User Summary

A collected release of East India Company, and its two expansions: Privateer and Battle of Trafalgar.

106427.name: Denizens of the Transitive Planes
106427.description:
From the publisher's web site:

This collection reveals the native creatures from the Astral Plane, Ethereal Plane, and the Plane of Shadow. The following old edition monsters have been converted to v3.5 rules - apparition, astral whale, astral searcher, astral streaker, berbalang, chronolily, chulcrix, devete, dhour, astral dragon, ebon tiger, ether sea horse, garmorm, gk'lok, gloomwing, ether golem, kodragon, magran, meme, memedi, nathri, nethling, plasm, shadeling, spectral hound, planar spider, shadow symbiont, terithran, translator, and tween.

106428.name: Denizens of the Inner Planes
106428.description:
From the publisher's web site:

This collection details the native creatures from the Elemental Planes, Paraelemental Planes, Quasielemental Planes, and the Energy Planes. The following old edition monsters have been converted to v3.5 rules - aerial servant, archomental, balhiir, blazon, bzastra, chososion, darklight, denzelian, dharum suhn, dragon horse, drelb, egarus, element creature, elemental of chaos, elemental of law, negative elementite swarm, entrope, firetail, facet, noble genies, tasked genies, giggag swarm, helian, hgaun, horde, khargra, klyndes, lavaworm, mephits, mihstu, nimbus, giant nautilus, ooze sprite, pech, negative pseudoelemental, negative quasielementals (ash, dust, salt, & vacuum), positive quasielementals (lightning, mineral, radiance, & steam), ruvoka, sandling, sandman, scape, scile swarm, shad, grand shadow, shocker, sislan, spectral death, sootbeast, suisseen, tome guardian, tsnng, ungulosin, elemental vermin, vacuous, vapor rat, vortex, waiveras, wavefire, and wind walker.

106429.name: Into the Darkness
106429.description:
User summary:

Into the Darkness is a short demo adventure published by Wizards of the Coast prior to the launch of 3rd edition. It consists of a four page adventure and a two-page "DM tipsheet" which has a brief summary of the 3rd edition rules.

106430.name: Electric Box 2
106430.description:
Play the sequel to the world’s most electrifying puzzle game!

Use the items in each level to connect electricity from the source to the target.

Source: The Game Website.

106431.name: Quesar
106431.description:
User summary:

This web enhancement for "Warriors of Heaven" describes the Quesar race in 2nd Edition AD&D terms.

From the front of the book:

The quesar are, at once, a source of pride and shame for the aasimon. Unlike the clumsy, nonsentient golems crafted by mortals, the quesar are radiant, free-thinking beings infused with life and an unshakable desire to uphold the cause of good. They are virtuous, strident, and compassionate by design. The aasimon, in their supreme arrogance, thought they had created the perfect servitors. However, once the eagerness to please their creators had worn off, the quesar rejected their role of servitude. They had every intention of remaining a powerful force for good, but they wanted to walk their own path. The aasimon reacted poorly to the quesar's push toward freedom, thinking them insolent and disrespectful. The rift between the creators and the created widened until, at last, this divergence led to war.

106432.name: The Secret Cow Level
106432.description:
From the publisher's web site:

The Secret Cow Level is the most popular Easter egg in computer gaming history, and now you can milk it for all it's worth in your D&D/Diablo games. All you need is a party of adventurers powerful enough to kill Diablo. You do have one of those, right? No? Well, send 'em back to Hell till they're tough enough to take out a demon lord. Because when they're done with that, a thousand moo-licious bovines intend to inflict udder depravity until they lay the adventurers low. Are you still checking your vision on that last paragraph? That's right, we said a thousand cows, all with poleaxes. Got damage resistance?

rpgseries.8338: Wizards of the Coast Web Enhancement

106433.name: Fiendish Aspects III
106433.description:
From the front of the book:

Welcome back to the series of web enhancements that bring you a slew of aspects that you can use in your game. In this final installment you'll find a collection of unusual and seldom seen demon princes, including an aspect of the Mother of Demons. Now you have aspects for almost every demon prince published in Fiendish Codex I, and you can use any of them to challenge mid-level adventurers. Remember that if a particular demon prince has more than one mode of operation (melee, spell-like abilities, some strange ability like Fraz-Urb'luu has), you can modify these aspects by changing the feats and/or the special abilities to reflect a different operating mode. For example, Baphomet has breath weapons, but the aspect included in this PDF series does not. If you want an aspect of Baphomet at the same challenge rating with breath weapons, then change the feats to less combat-intensive ones (from Baphomet's list) and replace Powerful Charge with one of Baphomet's breath weapons. There are a lot of possibilities with the aspects, and you should make them what you need for your campaign. As before, each aspect has entries with suggestions on how to use the aspect in the EBERRON® and FORGOTTEN REALMS® settings.

106434.name: Captain Tsubasa Mega CD
106434.description:
Captain Tsubasa is a 1994 video game released by Tecmo for the Sega Mega-CD and based on the popular Captain Tsubasa manga/anime series. It was published only in Japan.

The game is a further extension of Tecmo's "Cinematic Soccer" genre of games that appeared previously in other platforms, with the player watching from a cinematic angle and having to choose his actions from a timed list, with the results of these actions being animated on screen.

It is also notable for being the first CD-ROM based Captain Tsubasa video game, featuring improved spoken cutscenes with the purpose of retelling the original Captain Tsubasa story more closely to watching the anime.

Source: Wikipedia, "Captain Tsubasa (Mega-CD)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106435.name: WORLD WAR THREE: The Last Option
106435.description:
After more than 40 years of tension and arms build-up between the U.S. and the U.S.S.R., it has become clear the Soviets must take action in order to survive as a global empire. It is the summer of 1985. It has become World War III.

Take control of Soviet or NATO forces in a conflict that stretches from Oslo to Riyadh! With an all new combat system based on our favorite parts of the Axis & Allies series of games, you will nuke, bomb, and battle your way to victory using 7 different types of units, supplies, and diplomacy.

The playing board is a map of Europe, Western Asia, and the Middle East divided into areas that players control with their combat forces, represented by plastic figures like the ones from Axis & Allies or Table Tactics. Players can influence neutral countries, launch nuclear missile strikes, fly air combat missions, and attack with ground units to take control of the other side's countries and resources to force the enemy into surrender. Combat system works best with D12, but optional rules are included for a D6 system. The game is over when the victory conditions are met. Can be played by 2,3,or 4 people dividing the factions of USA, NATO, Soviet Union, and Warsaw Pact.

106436.name: Super Star Force: Jikuureki no Himitsu
106436.description:
Super Star Force: Jikuureki no Himitsu lit. "Secrets of the Space Calender") is a video game developed and published by Tecmo on November 11, 1986 for the Family Computer only in Japan.

It is the sequel to Tecmo's famous shoot 'em up arcade game, Star Force. Unlike most shoot 'em ups during the time of its release, Super Star Force is a combination of a shoot 'em up and an adventure game. Players must go back in time in order to defeat the evil Gordess. However, seven time stones must be collected from each level's hidden dungeon. The game starts in the year 2010 and players must destroy the enemies in the past so that the player can confront the final boss in the year 2137. When the player's ship is destroyed in the air area, his score time is cut in half The highest is 99,990; which is used as currency in the dungeons and the time travel sequences.

Source: Wikipedia, "Super Star Force: Jikuureki no Himitsu," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106437.name: Cosmic Family
106437.description:
From the back of the case:

Learning by Discovering and Exploring

The Perfect game for your child to lean and Play.

Over 20 early-learning mini games focusing on colours, shapes, puzzles and more.
An original and colourful universe with more than 300 interactive animations
Fun intuitive gameplay using the Wii Remote; use it to interact with various characters and environments.

106438.name: Final Star Force
106438.description:
Final Star Force (ファイナルスターフォース) is a 1992 arcade game developed and published by Tecmo. It is the third game in the Star Force series.

The gameplay of Final Star Force goes back to the formula of the original Star Force, but with updated graphics and some extra power-ups. Other things that have been changed from the original are the style of the title screen's logo, the background, and some enemies. Players control the two space fighter ships Blue Nova and Red Nova. There are three different power-ups to choose from called "Pulsators". Each name of a Pulsator has a letter at the beginning of it (e.g. A-Pulsator, B-Pulsator, C-Pulsator). The power-up system is similar to the one seen in the 1990 Raiden arcade game. Unlike other games that requires players to obtain powerups to enhance their ships, the power meter itself charges up automatically to increase their fighters' power.

Source: Wikipedia, "Final Star Force", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106439.name: Happy Feet
106439.description:
The console versions (for PS2, Wii, GameCube and PC) feature 3 different modes: a dancing mode which simulates Dance Dance Revolution with the player pushing the button in response to arrows on the screen, a fishing mode in which the player collects pebbles and shrimp as well as air bubbles in order to breathe, and a belly-sledding mode where the player sleds and collects the number of fish needed, sleds to beat a given time or races another character down the hill. In the Nintendo DS version of the game, the rhythm sequences use gameplay mechanics similar to those in Elite Beat Agents, though greatly simplified.

The game also features each of these modes for two players. In the dancing and swimming games, the players compete with each other, while cooperating with each other in the multi-player belly-sledding mode. Interestingly, the game features songs not in the film, such as "Shake Your Booty" from KC and the Sunshine Band for when Mumble hatches, and "I Will Survive" from Gloria Gaynor sung by Gloria when Mumble and her break up. These are for the dance modes of the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "Happy Feet (video game)," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106440.name: Mini Desktop Racing
106440.description:
Much like the popular Micro Machines, Mini Desktop Racing is displayed with a top-down view. Players race in a variety of mini cars around a variety of desktop areas. The game offers reasonably interactive courses by allowing players to "turn on fans" and "spill drinks" in attempts to hinder opponents. Every level has a variety of different things that can be interacted with. The game can be played in single-player mode, in which you can race against one or more computer-controlled opponents or in multiplayer where you can race against one other friend.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mini Desktop Racing," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106441.name: Gungriffon
106441.description:
Gungriffon is a series of video games developed by Game Arts and designed by the late Takeshi Miyaji. Gungriffon and Gungriffon II originally appeared for the Sega Saturn console in 1996, with more recent appearances in Gungriffon Blaze for the PlayStation 2 and Gungriffon: Allied Strike for the Xbox. The Gungriffon games are focused on piloting mecha: large, usually bipedal military vehicles. This game series refers to these machines as Armored Walking Gun Systems (AWGS). With the exception of the High-MACS design, the mecha in this series have a distinctly realistic design philosophy, which is more apparent in the more recent installments.

Source: Wikipedia, "GunGriffon: Allied Strike", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

106442.name: Skate City Heroes
106442.description:
From the back of the case:

Skate, jump, grind and trick your way through challenges & missions set in a futuristic metropolis to save your buddy from your arch-nemesis, Virus , and restore peace to the city! Use the Wii Remote and Nunchuk to bust out some sick tricks or, even better, break out the Wii Balance Board for ultra realistic shredding action!

106443.name: Field of Fire
106443.description:
From the back of the box:

One of the finest fighting forces during World War II was Easy Company of the First Infantry Division. Now, FIELD OF FIRE takes you back into time to assume command of these heroic men, retracing eight of their historical battles in North Africa and Europe.
